articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel braced on Thursday for the return of the bodies of infant Kfir Bibas and his four-year-old brother Ariel, the two youngest captives taken by Hamas in their Oct. 7, 2023 attack and among the most potent symbols of the trauma inflicted that day.
articles.title: Israel prepares to receive bodies of youngest Gaza hostages

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan, Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Dozens of Russians are being subjected to compulsory psychiatric treatment because of their political views, according to lawyers and human rights groups - a trend they say has gathered pace since the start of the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: In Russia, dozens of dissenters are held as psychiatric patients

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces have taken back more than 800 square km (309 square miles) of territory from Ukraine in the Kursk region of western Russia, or about 64% of the total taken by Ukraine since an incursion began last year, a top Russian general said.
articles.title: Russia says has taken back major chunk of Kursk region from Ukrainian forces

articles.author: Margaryta Chornokondratenko, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: As the air raid siren sounded for a ballistic missile threat in Kyiv, dozens of eight-year-old children descended into their primary school's basement with pencils and textbooks to continue class.
articles.title: Emotional trauma piles up for Ukraine's children three years after invasion

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A motorcade carrying South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol arrived on Thursday at the Seoul Central District Court, where the embattled leader is due to attend the first hearing of his criminal trial over insurrection charges.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon set to attend his first criminal trial hearing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A group of 50 Chinese nationals plucked from scam centres in Myanmar crossed into Thailand to take a flight home, a Thai police official said on Thursday, as part of a multinational effort to repatriate 600 Chinese.
articles.title: Chinese extricated from Myanmar scam centres fly home from Thailand

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Support from U.S. President Donald Trump's administration for Taiwan remains "very strong" and Taiwan is looking at more purchases from the country, including LNG, to help balance trade, a senior Taiwan security official said on Thursday.
articles.title: US support for Taiwan remains 'very strong,' Taiwanese official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Austria's two biggest centrist parties are moving quickly towards a coalition deal without the far-right Freedom Party (FPO) after it failed to form a government, party officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Austria moves towards centrist coalition deal after far right fails

articles.author: Tim Cocks
articles.description: Foreign ministers from the G20 top economies were to meet in South Africa on Thursday and Friday, amid tensions between members over the Ukraine war, trade disputes and with the top U.S. diplomat staying away owing to a feud with the hosts.
articles.title: G20 foreign ministers gather amid tensions over trade, Ukraine

articles.author: Budi Satriawan, Yuddy Budiman
articles.description: Thousands of students staged 'Dark Indonesia' protests in cities across the country on Thursday against budget cuts and other policies of President Prabowo Subianto, fearing they will undermine social support systems and their futures.
articles.title: Students lead 'Dark Indonesia' protests against budget cuts
